about.about_title: What is the Mexico Event of CLIHC 2026?
about.about_text:
The Mexico Event of CLIHC 2026 is an official in-person venue of the 12th Latin American Conference on Human–Computer Interaction (CLIHC 2026), organized as part of the 2026 edition of the conference, which is held in a distributed format with two in-person venues across Latin America.

The Mexico Event aims to broaden the participation of the Latin American Human–Computer Interaction (HCI) community by offering spaces for meeting, discussion, and collaboration through academic, educational, and industrial activities. This venue features its own local program, activities, and organization, academically articulated with the rest of the conference.

Within the distributed model of CLIHC 2026, some academic and editorial processes, such as the management of long papers and the official proceedings, are coordinated centrally to ensure coherence and academic quality. Complementarily, the Mexico Event develops local calls and activities, including short papers, posters, workshops, and tutorials, as well as an in-person agenda organized by its local committee.

In this way, the Mexico Event actively contributes to the academic and professional diversity of CLIHC 2026, strengthening the exchange between academia, industry, and society from its regional context.

organizers.title: Organizers
organizers.intro: This page presents the Local Organizing Committee for the Oaxaca, Mexico venue of CLIHC 2026. The committee is responsible for planning and coordinating local activities, event logistics, and engagement with the academic, professional, and institutional communities at the Oaxaca site.
